item.title: Chapter 1 ‚Äì What is Hugo?
item.description:
Learning Hugo ‚Äì Chapter 1

‚ÄúSo‚Ä¶ What Exactly Is Hugo, and Why Should a Developer Care?‚Äù

Welcome to Chapter 1 of the Learning Hugo Series in Knowwvana.learn.

This chapter is written in a style inspired by the Head First series you already love:
lots of conversations, visuals (in text form), brain-friendly metaphors (tech-only), and plenty of ‚Äúaha!‚Äù moments.

Our goal for this page:

If someone reads only this chapter, they should have a rock-solid mental model of Hugo, its history, creator, tech stack, purpose, and where it fits in a modern developer‚Äôs toolbox.

item.title: Chapter 1 ‚Äì What is Hugo?
item.description:
Learning Hugo ‚Äì Chapter 1

‚ÄúSo‚Ä¶ What Exactly Is Hugo?‚Äù

üß† Introduction ‚Äì What this page will teach you

Congratulations ‚Äî you‚Äôve just opened Page 1 of your Hugo journey. This chapter is ALL about understanding what Hugo is, why it exists, who created it, and where it fits in the modern web world.

By the end of this page, you‚Äôll know everything needed without searching anywhere else.

üìò Table of Contents

  1. What is a Static Site Generator?
  2. Meet Hugo ‚Äì the Fastest Static Site Generator
  3. Who Created Hugo?
  4. What Hugo Is Made Of (Tech Stack)
  5. What Can You Build With Hugo?
  6. Why Developers Prefer Hugo
  7. Mental Models & Illustrations
  8. Practical Examples
  9. Summary
  10. Knowledge Check

üß© 1. What Is a Static Site Generator?

Think of a restaurant. Dynamic sites cook food fresh every time. Static site generators prepare dishes ahead of time ‚Äî instant serving.

item.title: Step-by-Step Guide-Building an Authoritative Source from CSV in SailPoint IIQ
item.description:
Step-by-Step Guide: Building an Authoritative Source from CSV in SailPoint IIQ

üìò Purpose of This Document

This document provides a complete, beginner-friendly, step-by-step guide for creating an Authoritative Source Application in SailPoint IdentityIQ using a CSV (Delimited File).

It explains:

  • What each IAM and SailPoint term actually means
  • Why each configuration step is required
  • How to build the HR Employees authoritative application correctly
  • How schema discovery works
  • How IdentityIQ converts CSV rows into managed identities
  • How to preview, test, and validate the setup
  • A final cheat sheet summarizing all required values

By the end of this guide, you will fully understand how IdentityIQ ingests employee data from a CSV file, how it becomes an authoritative identity source, and how this process powers IdentityIQ Identity Lifecycle, Access Certifications, Policy Violations, and all downstream identity governance functions.

echo “# SetupSailpointDockerDesktop” » README.md git init git add README.md git commit -m “first commit” git branch -M main git remote add origin https://github.com/Knowwvana/SetupSailpointDockerDesktop.git git push -u origin main

SailPoint IdentityIQ 8.4 ‚Äì Docker Dev Environment (DevDays 2025)

This guide explains, step by step, how to set up a local SailPoint IdentityIQ 8.4 development environment using:

  • SailPoint Developer Days Docker reference:
    • ‚ÄúLeveraging SailPoint IdentityIQ and Docker for seamless development‚Äù (Dev Days session)
  • GitHub repo:
    • iiq-docker-developer-days-2025 (Yannick Beot ‚Äì SailPoint)
  • Official IdentityIQ 8.4 distribution from SailPoint Compass

The goal is that anyone can follow this and get IdentityIQ running locally on Docker Desktop from scratch.

SailPoint IIQ ‚ûù Azure Migration

A Complete Architecture & Step-by-Step Blueprint

Author: Atul
Version: 1.1
Date: 2025-11-23

üìå Overview

This document provides a complete, official, non-assumptive blueprint for performing a SailPoint IdentityIQ ‚Üí Microsoft Azure (Entra ID + Identity Governance) migration.
It contains:

  • What actually gets migrated
  • Architecture diagrams
  • Extraction ‚Üí Transformation ‚Üí Load phases
  • REST vs SPConfig vs SCIM (differences & usage)
  • Web-based Migration Platform Architecture
  • POC plan using ASP.NET + SPConfig + REST
  • Roadmap for the complete migration tool

This is the master overview document.
A detailed step-by-step migration guide will be created later during implementation.
